Using conveyors to move onions through the processing line, which may require operating the machinery and guiding the onions.
Utilizing automatic sorters to categorize onions by size and quality. This may require adjusting the settings or running the sorter manually when necessary.

Using the MEDI-Standling machine for heat treatments to manage pests. This may involve operating the machine, applying heat to affected areas, or supervising the process.

Applying organic or chemical-free methods to control pests like onion thrips. This involves spraying or using other organic pest control measures. The exact method would depend on the farmer's practices.
